swgg

swgg-github-all (2018.2.2)

this zero-dependency package will provide a swagger-client for github-all's web-apis, with a working web-demo

download standalone app

javascript code

/*
 * initialize swgg-client
 * 1. download currently-loaded apis to file swagger.json:
 *     $ curl -L "http://127.0.0.1:8081/assets.swgg.swagger.json" > swagger.json
 * 2. npm install swgg
 *     $ npm install swgg
 * 3. run code below to initialize swgg-client
 * 4. (optional) edit file swagger.json to suit your needs
 */
var swgg;
swgg = require("swgg");
swgg.apiUpdate(require("./swagger.json"));
console.log("printing currently loaded apis ...");
console.log(JSON.stringify(Object.keys(swgg.apiDict).sort(), null, 4));
console.log("initialized swgg-client");
[ base url: / ]
rendering swagger.json

I.
github-activity: Activity. Serving up the 'social' in Social Coding, the Activity APIs provide access to notifications, subscriptions, and timelines. [https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/](https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/) expand / collapse operations

Activity.

Serving up the 'social' in Social Coding, the Activity APIs provide access to notifications, subscriptions, and timelines.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/

1. GET /users/{username}/events/orgs/{org} Events - List events for an organization. This is the user's organization dashboard. You must be authenticated as the user to view this. https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-events-for-an-organization

description

Events - List events for an organization.

This is the user's organization dashboard. You must be authenticated as the user to view this.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-events-for-an-organization

parameters

name and description data type value schema
access_token

OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)

https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication

 string
user-agent
(required)

All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.

https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required

 string
accept

accept header

https://developer.github.com/v3/media

 string
username
(required) string
org
(required) string

response messages

http status code reason
default

default response

javascript code

/*
 * reproduce api-call "GET /users/{}/events/orgs/{}"
 * 1. initialize swgg-client from previous step
 * 2. run code below to reproduce api-call
 */
swgg.apiDict["GET /users/{}/events/orgs/{}"].ajax({
    "paramDict": {
        "user-agent": "Awesome-Octocat-App",
        "username": "abcd1234",
        "org": "abcd1234"
    }
}, function (error, data) {
    if (error) {
        console.error(error);
        return;
    }
    console.log(data.responseJson || data.responseText);
});

curl request

curl \
--request GET \
--header 'user-agent: Awesome-Octocat-App' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-binary '' \
"https://api.github.com/users/abcd1234/events/orgs/abcd1234"

response status code


    
response headers

    

    
response body

    

    









    2.
    GET
    /users/{username}/events
    Events - List events performed by a user.

If you are authenticated as the given user, you will see your private events. Otherwise, you'll only see public events.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-events-performed-by-a-user





    
    
description

    
Events - List events performed by a user.


If you are authenticated as the given user, you will see your private events. Otherwise, you'll only see public events.


https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-events-performed-by-a-user



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    username
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    
    
response messages

    

        http status code
        reason
    

    
    

        default
        
default response

    3.
    GET
    /users/{username}/received_events
    Events - List events that a user has received.

These are events that you've received by watching repos and following users. If you are authenticated as the given user, you will see private events. Otherwise, you'll only see public events.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-events-that-a-user-has-received





    
    
description

    
Events - List events that a user has received.


These are events that you've received by watching repos and following users. If you are authenticated as the given user, you will see private events. Otherwise, you'll only see public events.


https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-events-that-a-user-has-received

        data type

    4.
    GET
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}/issues/events
    Events - List issue events for a repository.

Repository issue events have a different format than other events, as documented in the [Issue Events API](https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/events/).

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-issue-events-for-a-repository





    
    
description

    
Events - List issue events for a repository.


Repository issue events have a different format than other events, as documented in the Issue Events API.


https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-issue-events-for-a-repository

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema

    11.
    GET
    /feeds
    Feeds - List Feeds.

GitHub provides several timeline resources in [Atom](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atom_(standard)) format. The Feeds API lists all the feeds available to the authenticated user:

- **Timeline**: The GitHub global public timeline

- **User**: The public timeline for any user, using [URI template](https://developer.github.com/v3/#hypermedia)

- **Current user public**: The public timeline for the authenticated user

- **Current user**: The private timeline for the authenticated user

- **Current user actor**: The private timeline for activity created by the authenticated user

- **Current user organizations**: The private timeline for the organizations the authenticated user is a member of.

**Note**: Private feeds are only returned when [authenticating via Basic Auth](https://developer.github.com/v3/#basic-authentication) since current feed URIs use the older, non revocable auth tokens.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/feeds/#list-feeds





    
    
description

    
Feeds - List Feeds.


GitHub provides several timeline resources in Atom) format. The Feeds API lists all the feeds available to the authenticated user:


    

  • Timeline: The GitHub global public timeline
    

    • 

  • User: The public timeline for any user, using URI template
    

    • 

  • Current user public: The public timeline for the authenticated user
    

    • 

  • Current user: The private timeline for the authenticated user
    

    • 

  • Current user actor: The private timeline for activity created by the authenticated user
    

    • 

  • Current user organizations: The private timeline for the organizations the authenticated user is a member of.
    

    • 



Note: Private feeds are only returned when authenticating via Basic Auth since current feed URIs use the older, non revocable auth tokens.


https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/feeds/#list-feeds



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

    13.
    GET
    /notifications/threads/{id}/subscription
    Notifications - Get a Thread Subscription.

This checks to see if the current user is subscribed to a thread. You can also [get a Repository subscription](https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/watching/#get-a-repository-subscription).

Note that subscriptions are only generated if a user is participating in a conversation--for example, they've replied to the thread, were **@mention**ed, or manually subscribe to a thread.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/notifications/#get-a-thread-subscription





    
    
description

    
Notifications - Get a Thread Subscription.


This checks to see if the current user is subscribed to a thread. You can also get a Repository subscription.


Note that subscriptions are only generated if a user is participating in a conversation--for example, they've replied to the thread, were @mentioned, or manually subscribe to a thread.


https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/notifications/#get-a-thread-subscription



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept

    14.
    GET
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}/notifications
    Notifications - List your notifications in a repository.

List all notifications for the current user.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/notifications/#list-your-notifications-in-a-repository





    
    
description

    
Notifications - List your notifications in a repository.


List all notifications for the current user.


https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/notifications/#list-your-notifications-in-a-repository



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    owner
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    repo
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    before
    
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    
    
response messages

        reason

    19.
    PUT
    /notifications/threads/{id}/subscription
    Notifications - Set a Thread Subscription.

This lets you subscribe or unsubscribe from a conversation. Unsubscribing from a conversation mutes all future notifications (until you comment or get **@mention**ed once more).

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/notifications/#set-a-thread-subscription





    
    
description

    
Notifications - Set a Thread Subscription.


This lets you subscribe or unsubscribe from a conversation. Unsubscribing from a conversation mutes all future notifications (until you comment or get @mentioned once more).


https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/notifications/#set-a-thread-subscription



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    id
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    body
    
(required)
    

object

    
    

        
{
    "ignored": false,
    "subscribed": false
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "ignored": {
        "description": "Determines if all notifications should be blocked from this thread\n",
        "type": "boolean",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "Determines if all notifications should be blocked from this thread\n"
        ]
    },
    "subscribed": {
        "description": "Determines if notifications should be received from this thread\n",
        "type": "boolean",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "Determines if notifications should be received from this thread\n"
        ]
    }
}





    
    
    
response messages

    

        http status code
        reason
    

    
    

        default
        
default response


    

    
    
    
javascript code

    27.
    DELETE
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}/subscription
    Watching - Delete a Repository Subscription.

This endpoint should only be used to stop watching a repository. To control whether or not you wish to receive notifications from a repository, [set the repository's subscription manually](https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/watching/#set-a-repository-subscription).

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/watching/#delete-a-repository-subscription





    
    
description

    
Watching - Delete a Repository Subscription.


This endpoint should only be used to stop watching a repository. To control whether or not you wish to receive notifications from a repository, set the repository's subscription manually.

All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept

(required)

All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.

    body
    
(required)
    

object

    
    

        
{
    "ignored": false,
    "subscribed": false
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "ignored": {
        "description": "Determines if all notifications should be blocked from this repository.\n",
        "type": "boolean",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "Determines if all notifications should be blocked from this repository.\n"
        ]
    },
    "subscribed": {
        "description": "Determines if notifications should be received from this repository.\n",
        "type": "boolean",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "Determines if notifications should be received from this repository.\n"
        ]
    }
}

        http status code
        reason
    

    
    

        default

II.
github-apps:
        GitHub Apps.

For information on how to authenticate as a GitHub App, see "[Authentication Options for GitHub Apps](https://developer.github.com/apps/building-github-apps/authentication-options-for-github-apps#authenticating-as-a-github-app)."

**Note:** To access the API with your integration, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` Header for your requests.

```application/vnd.github.machine-man-preview+json```

[https://developer.github.com/v3/apps/](https://developer.github.com/v3/apps/)

    
    expand / collapse operations




    
GitHub Apps.


For information on how to authenticate as a GitHub App, see "Authentication Options for GitHub Apps."


Note: To access the API with your integration, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept Header for your requests.


application/vnd.github.machine-man-preview+json


https://developer.github.com/v3/apps/

    3.
    GET
    /apps/{app_slug}
    GitHub Apps - Get a single GitHub App.

**Note**: The ```:app_slug``` is just the URL-friendly name of your GitHub App. You can find this on the settings page for your GitHub App (e.g., ```https://github.com/settings/apps/:app_slug```).

https://developer.github.com/v3/apps/#get-a-single-github-app

III.
github-enterprise:
        Enterprise.

See the [Enterprise homepage](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/) for information about the supported releases. These Enterprise-specific endpoints are available:

- [Admin Stats](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/admin_stats/)

- [Global Webhooks](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/global_webhooks)

- [LDAP](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/ldap/)

- [License](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/license/)

- [Management Console](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/management_console/)

- [Organization Administration](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/orgs/)

- [Pre-receive Environments](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/pre_receive_environments/)

- [Pre-receive Hooks](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/pre_receive_hooks/)

- [Search Indexing](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/search_indexing/)

- [User Administration](https://developer.github.com/v3/users/administration/)

- [Organization Pre-receive Hooks](https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/pre_receive_hooks/)

- [Repository Pre-receive Hooks](https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/pre_receive_hooks/)

[https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise/](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise/)

    
    expand / collapse operations




    
Enterprise.


See the Enterprise homepage for information about the supported releases. These Enterprise-specific endpoints are available:


    

  • Admin Stats
    

    • 

  • Global Webhooks
    

    • 

  • LDAP
    

    • 

  • License
    

    • 

  • Management Console
    

    • 

  • Organization Administration
    

    • 

  • Pre-receive Environments
    

    • 

  • Pre-receive Hooks
    

    • 

  • Search Indexing
    

    • 

  • User Administration
    

    • 

  • Organization Pre-receive Hooks
    

    • 

  • Repository Pre-receive Hooks
    

    • 



https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise/

    2.
    POST
    /admin/hooks
    Global Webhooks - Create a global hook.

**Note:** The [Global Webhooks API](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/global_webhooks/) is currently available for developers to preview. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.superpro-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/global_webhooks/#create-a-global-hook





    
    
description

    
Global Webhooks - Create a global hook.


Note: The Global Webhooks API is currently available for developers to preview. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.superpro-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/global_webhooks/#create-a-global-hook



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token

https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication

    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
(required)
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    body
    
(required)
    

object

    
    

        
{
    "active": true,
    "config": {},
    "events": [
        "organization"
    ],
    "name": "abcd1234"
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "active": {
        "default": true,
        "description": "Determines if notifications are sent when the webhook is triggered. Set to ```true``` to send notifications. Default: ```true```.\n",
        "type": "boolean",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "Determines if notifications are sent when the webhook is triggered. Set to ```true``` to send notifications. Default: ```true```.\n"
        ]
    },
    "config": {
        "description": "**Required**. Key/value pairs to provide settings for this webhook. [These are defined below](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/global_webhooks/#create-hook-config-params).\n",
        "type": "object",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required**. Key/value pairs to provide settings for this webhook. [These are defined below](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/global_webhooks/#create-hook-config-params).\n"
        ]
    },
    "events": {
        "default": [
            "organization"
        ],
        "description": "The [events](https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/types/) that trigger this webhook. A global webhook can be triggered by ```user``` and ```organization``` events. Default: ```user``` and ```organization```.\n",
        "items": {
            "type": "string"
        },
        "type": "array",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "The [events](https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/types/) that trigger this webhook. A global webhook can be triggered by ```user``` and ```organization``` events. Default: ```user``` and ```organization```.\n"
        ]
    },
    "name": {
        "description": "**Required**. Must be passed as \"web\".\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required**. Must be passed as \"web\".\n"
        ]
    }
}

        http status code
        reason
    

    
    

        default

    4.
    PATCH
    /admin/hooks/{id}
    Global Webhooks - Edit a global hook.

**Note:** The [Global Webhooks API](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/global_webhooks/) is currently available for developers to preview. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.superpro-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

Parameters that are not provided will be overwritten with the default value or removed if no default exists.

https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/global_webhooks/#edit-a-global-hook





    
    
description

    
Global Webhooks - Edit a global hook.


Note: The Global Webhooks API is currently available for developers to preview. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.superpro-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


Parameters that are not provided will be overwritten with the default value or removed if no default exists.


https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/global_webhooks/#edit-a-global-hook

    5.

**Note:** The [Global Webhooks API](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/global_webhooks/) is currently available for developers to preview. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.superpro-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.

    6.
    GET
    /admin/hooks
    Global Webhooks - List global hooks.

**Note:** The [Global Webhooks API](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/global_webhooks/) is currently available for developers to preview. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.superpro-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/global_webhooks/#list-global-hooks





    
    
description

    
Global Webhooks - List global hooks.


Note: The Global Webhooks API is currently available for developers to preview. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.superpro-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/global_webhooks/#list-global-hooks

    7.
    POST
    /admin/hooks/{id}/pings
    Global Webhooks - Ping a global hook.

**Note:** The [Global Webhooks API](https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/global_webhooks/) is currently available for developers to preview. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.superpro-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

This will trigger a [ping event](https://developer.github.com/webhooks/#ping-event) to be sent to the hook.

https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/global_webhooks/#ping-a-global-hook





    
    
description

    
Global Webhooks - Ping a global hook.


Note: The Global Webhooks API is currently available for developers to preview. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.superpro-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


This will trigger a ping event to be sent to the hook.


https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/global_webhooks/#ping-a-global-hook



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token

https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication

(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required

    8.
    POST
    /admin/ldap/teams/{team_id}/sync
    LDAP - Sync LDAP mapping for a team.

Note that this API call does not automatically initiate an LDAP sync. Rather, if a ```201``` is returned, the sync job is queued successfully, and is performed when the instance is ready.

https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/ldap/#sync-ldap-mapping-for-a-team





    
    
description

    
LDAP - Sync LDAP mapping for a team.


Note that this API call does not automatically initiate an LDAP sync. Rather, if a 201 is returned, the sync job is queued successfully, and is performed when the instance is ready.


https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/ldap/#sync-ldap-mapping-for-a-team

    19.
    GET
    /setup/api/settings/authorized-keys

    23.
    POST
    /setup/api/start
    Management Console - Upload a license for the first time.

When you boot a virtual machine for the first time, you can use the following endpoint to upload a license:

https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/management_console/#upload-a-license-for-the-first-time





    
    
description

    
Management Console - Upload a license for the first time.


When you boot a virtual machine for the first time, you can use the following endpoint to upload a license:


https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/management_console/#upload-a-license-for-the-first-time



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    body
    
(required)
    

object

    
    

        
{
    "license": "abcd1234",
    "password": "abcd1234",
    "settings": "abcd1234"
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "license": {
        "description": "**Required**. The content of your .ghl license file.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required**. The content of your .ghl license file.\n"
        ]
    },
    "password": {
        "description": "You **must** provide a password only if you are uploading your license for the first time. If you previously set a password through the web interface, you don't need this parameter.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "You **must** provide a password only if you are uploading your license for the first time. If you previously set a password through the web interface, you don't need this parameter.\n"
        ]
    },
    "settings": {
        "description": "An optional JSON string containing the installation settings.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "An optional JSON string containing the installation settings.\n"
        ]
    }
}





    
    
    
response messages

    

        http status code
        reason
    

    
    

        default

        default

javascript code

    

    
curl request

    

    
response status code

    

    
response headers

    

    
response body

    

    









    32.
    POST
    /admin/pre-receive-environments/{id}/downloads
    Pre-receive Environments - Trigger a pre-receive environment download.

Triggers a new download of the environment tarball from the environment's ```image_url```. When the download is finished, the newly downloaded tarball will overwrite the existing environment.

https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/pre_receive_environments/#trigger-a-pre-receive-environment-download





    
    
description

    
Pre-receive Environments - Trigger a pre-receive environment download.


Triggers a new download of the environment tarball from the environment's image_url. When the download is finished, the newly downloaded tarball will overwrite the existing environment.


https://developer.github.com/v3/enterprise-admin/pre_receive_environments/#trigger-a-pre-receive-environment-download



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required

    "environment": {},

    "script_repository": {}

{
    "environment": {
        "description": "**Required** The pre-receive environment where the script is executed.\n",
        "type": "object",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required** The pre-receive environment where the script is executed.\n"
        ]
    },
    "name": {
        "description": "**Required** The name of the hook.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required** The name of the hook.\n"
        ]
    },
    "script": {
        "description": "**Required** The script that the hook runs.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required** The script that the hook runs.\n"
        ]
    },
    "script_repository": {
        "description": "**Required** The GitHub repository where the script is kept.\n",
        "type": "object",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required** The GitHub repository where the script is kept.\n"
        ]
    }
}

        http status code
        reason

IV.
github-gists:
        Gists.

**Note:** To help with migrating from our REST API v3 to GraphQL API v4, we're introducing a preview period to include the [GraphQL ```node_id```](https://developer.github.com/v3/#graphql-global-relay-ids) in the response for many REST API v3 resources. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2017-12-19-graphql-node-id) for full details. To access ```node_id``` during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.jean-grey-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

[https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/](https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/)

    
    expand / collapse operations




    
Gists.


Note: To help with migrating from our REST API v3 to GraphQL API v4, we're introducing a preview period to include the GraphQL node_id in the response for many REST API v3 resources. See the blog post for full details. To access node_id during the preview period, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.jean-grey-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/







    1.

https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#create-a-gist

All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required

(required)

{
    "description": "abcd1234",
    "files": {}
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "description": {
        "description": "A description of the gist.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "A description of the gist.\n"
        ]
    },
    "files": {
        "description": "**Required**. Files that make up this gist.\n",
        "type": "object",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required**. Files that make up this gist.\n"
        ]
    }
}

        ]

    14.
    GET
    /gists/public
    Gists - List all public gists.

List all public gists sorted by most recently updated to least recently updated.

Note: With [pagination](https://developer.github.com/v3/#pagination), you can fetch up to 3000 gists. For example, you can fetch 100 pages with 30 gists per page or 30 pages with 100 gists per page.

https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#list-all-public-gists





    
    
description

    
Gists - List all public gists.


List all public gists sorted by most recently updated to least recently updated.


Note: With pagination, you can fetch up to 3000 gists. For example, you can fetch 100 pages with 30 gists per page or 30 pages with 100 gists per page.


https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#list-all-public-gists

response body

    

    













    
        
V.
github-git:
        Git Data.

The Git Database API gives you access to read and write raw Git objects to your Git database on GitHub and to list and update your references (branch heads and tags).

This basically allows you to reimplement a lot of Git functionality over our API - by creating raw objects directly into the database and updating branch references you could technically do just about anything that Git can do without having Git installed.

Git DB API functions will return a ```409 Conflict``` if the git repository for a Repository is empty or unavailable. This typically means it is being created still. Contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact) if this response status persists.

For more information on the Git object database, please read the [Git Internals](http://git-scm.com/book/en/v1/Git-Internals) chapter of the Pro Git book.

As an example, if you wanted to commit a change to a file in your repository, you would:

- get the current commit object

- retrieve the tree it points to

- retrieve the content of the blob object that tree has for that particular file path

- change the content somehow and post a new blob object with that new content, getting a blob SHA back

- post a new tree object with that file path pointer replaced with your new blob SHA getting a tree SHA back

- create a new commit object with the current commit SHA as the parent and the new tree SHA, getting a commit SHA back

- update the reference of your branch to point to the new commit SHA

It might seem complex, but it's actually pretty simple when you understand the model and it opens up a ton of things you could potentially do with the API.

[https://developer.github.com/v3/git/](https://developer.github.com/v3/git/)

    
    expand / collapse operations




    
Git Data.


The Git Database API gives you access to read and write raw Git objects to your Git database on GitHub and to list and update your references (branch heads and tags).


This basically allows you to reimplement a lot of Git functionality over our API - by creating raw objects directly into the database and updating branch references you could technically do just about anything that Git can do without having Git installed.


Git DB API functions will return a 409 Conflict if the git repository for a Repository is empty or unavailable. This typically means it is being created still. Contact GitHub support if this response status persists.


For more information on the Git object database, please read the Git Internals chapter of the Pro Git book.


As an example, if you wanted to commit a change to a file in your repository, you would:


    

  • get the current commit object
    

    • 

  • retrieve the tree it points to
    

    • 

  • retrieve the content of the blob object that tree has for that particular file path
    

    • 

  • change the content somehow and post a new blob object with that new content, getting a blob SHA back
    

    • 

  • post a new tree object with that file path pointer replaced with your new blob SHA getting a tree SHA back
    

    • 

  • create a new commit object with the current commit SHA as the parent and the new tree SHA, getting a commit SHA back
    

    • 

  • update the reference of your branch to point to the new commit SHA
    

    • 



It might seem complex, but it's actually pretty simple when you understand the model and it opens up a ton of things you could potentially do with the API.


https://developer.github.com/v3/git/







    1.
    POST
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}/git/blobs
    Git Blobs - Create a Blob.

https://developer.github.com/v3/git/blobs/#create-a-blob





    
    
description

    
Git Blobs - Create a Blob.


https://developer.github.com/v3/git/blobs/#create-a-blob



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    owner
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    repo
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    body
    
(required)
    

object

    
    

        
{
    "content": "Content of the blob",
    "encoding": "utf-8"
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "content": {
        "default": "Content of the blob",
        "description": "**Required**. The new blob's content.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required**. The new blob's content.\n"
        ]
    },
    "encoding": {
        "default": "utf-8",
        "description": "The encoding used for ```content```. Currently, ```\"utf-8\"``` and ```\"base64\"``` are supported. Default: ```\"utf-8\"```.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "The encoding used for ```content```. Currently, ```\"utf-8\"``` and ```\"base64\"``` are supported. Default: ```\"utf-8\"```.\n"
        ]
    }
}





    
    
    
response messages

    

        http status code
        reason
    

    
    

        default
        
default response


    

    
    
    
javascript code

response status code

    

    
response headers

    

    
response body

    "message": {
        "default": "my commit message",
        "description": "**Required**. The commit message\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required**. The commit message\n"
        ]
    },
    "tree": {
        "default": "827efc6d56897b048c772eb4087f854f46256132",
        "description": "**Required**. The SHA of the tree object this commit points to\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required**. The SHA of the tree object this commit points to\n"
        ]
    }

    11.
    POST
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}/git/tags
    Git Tags - Create a Tag Object.

Note that creating a tag object does not create the reference that makes a tag in Git. If you want to create an annotated tag in Git, you have to do this call to create the tag object, and then [create](https://developer.github.com/v3/git/refs/#create-a-reference) the ```refs/tags/[tag]``` reference. If you want to create a lightweight tag, you only have to [create](https://developer.github.com/v3/git/refs/#create-a-reference) the tag reference - this call would be unnecessary.

https://developer.github.com/v3/git/tags/#create-a-tag-object





    
    
description

    
Git Tags - Create a Tag Object.


Note that creating a tag object does not create the reference that makes a tag in Git. If you want to create an annotated tag in Git, you have to do this call to create the tag object, and then create the refs/tags/[tag] reference. If you want to create a lightweight tag, you only have to create the tag reference - this call would be unnecessary.


https://developer.github.com/v3/git/tags/#create-a-tag-object



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    owner
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    repo
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    body
    
(required)
    

object

    
    

        
{
    "message": "initial version\n",
    "object": "c3d0be41ecbe669545ee3e94d31ed9a4bc91ee3c",
    "tag": "v0.0.1",
    "tagger": {
        "date": "2011-06-17T14:53:35-07:00",
        "email": "schacon@gmail.com",
        "name": "Scott Chacon"
    }
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "message": {
        "default": "initial version\n",
        "description": "The tag message\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "The tag message\n"
        ]
    },
    "object": {
        "default": "c3d0be41ecbe669545ee3e94d31ed9a4bc91ee3c",
        "description": "The SHA of the git object this is tagging\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "The SHA of the git object this is tagging\n"
        ]
    },
    "tag": {
        "default": "v0.0.1",
        "description": "The tag\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "The tag\n"
        ]
    },
    "tagger": {
        "default": {
            "date": "2011-06-17T14:53:35-07:00",
            "email": "schacon@gmail.com",
            "name": "Scott Chacon"
        },
        "description": "An object with information about the individual creating the tag.\n",
        "type": "object",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "An object with information about the individual creating the tag.\n"
        ]
    }
}





    
    
    
response messages

    

        http status code
        reason
    

    
    

        default
        
default response


    

    
    
    
javascript code

    

    
curl request

    

    
response status code

    

    
response headers

    

    
response body

    14.
    POST
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}/git/trees
    Git Trees - Create a Tree.

The tree creation API will take nested entries as well. If both a tree and a nested path modifying that tree are specified, it will overwrite the contents of that tree with the new path contents and write a new tree out.

https://developer.github.com/v3/git/trees/#create-a-tree





    
    
description

    
Git Trees - Create a Tree.


The tree creation API will take nested entries as well. If both a tree and a nested path modifying that tree are specified, it will overwrite the contents of that tree with the new path contents and write a new tree out.


https://developer.github.com/v3/git/trees/#create-a-tree



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    owner
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    repo
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    body
    
(required)
    

object

    
    

        
{
    "base_tree": "abcd1234"
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "base_tree": {
        "description": "The SHA1 of the tree you want to update with new data. If you don't set this, the commit will be created on top of everything; however, it will only contain your change, the rest of your files will show up as deleted.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "The SHA1 of the tree you want to update with new data. If you don't set this, the commit will be created on top of everything; however, it will only contain your change, the rest of your files will show up as deleted.\n"
        ]
    }
}

        reason

VI.
github-issues:
        Issues.

Issues use [these custom media types](https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/#custom-media-types). You can read more about the use of media types in the API [here](https://developer.github.com/v3/media/).

**Note:** To help with migrating from our REST API v3 to GraphQL API v4, we're introducing a preview period to include the [GraphQL ```node_id```](https://developer.github.com/v3/#graphql-global-relay-ids) in the response for many REST API v3 resources. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2017-12-19-graphql-node-id) for full details. To access ```node_id``` during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.jean-grey-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

[https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/](https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/)

    
    expand / collapse operations




    
Issues.


Issues use these custom media types. You can read more about the use of media types in the API here.


Note: To help with migrating from our REST API v3 to GraphQL API v4, we're introducing a preview period to include the GraphQL node_id in the response for many REST API v3 resources. See the blog post for full details. To access node_id during the preview period, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.jean-grey-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/







    1.
    POST
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}/issues/{number}/assignees
    Issue Assignees - Add assignees to an issue.

Adds up to 10 assignees to an issue. Users already assigned to an issue are not replaced.

https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/assignees/#add-assignees-to-an-issue





    
    
description

    
Issue Assignees - Add assignees to an issue.


Adds up to 10 assignees to an issue. Users already assigned to an issue are not replaced.


https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/assignees/#add-assignees-to-an-issue



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema

{
    "description": {
        "description": "A description of the milestone.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "A description of the milestone.\n"
        ]
    },
    "due_on": {
        "description": "The milestone due date. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: ```YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ```.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "The milestone due date. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: ```YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ```.\n"
        ]
    },
    "title": {
        "description": "**Required**. The title of the milestone.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required**. The title of the milestone.\n"
        ]
    }
}

    PATCH

    },

        "description": "State of the issue. Either ```open``` or ```closed```.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "State of the issue. Either ```open``` or ```closed```.\n"
        ]
    },
    "title": {
        "description": "The title of the issue.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "The title of the issue.\n"

    33.
    GET
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}/issues/{number}
    Issues - Get a single issue.

**Note**: In the past, pull requests and issues were more closely aligned than they are now. As far as the API is concerned, every pull request is an issue, but not every issue is a pull request.

This endpoint may also return pull requests in the response. If an issue is a pull request, the object will include a ```pull_request``` key.

https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/#get-a-single-issue





    
    
description

    
Issues - Get a single issue.


Note: In the past, pull requests and issues were more closely aligned than they are now. As far as the API is concerned, every pull request is an issue, but not every issue is a pull request.


This endpoint may also return pull requests in the response. If an issue is a pull request, the object will include a pull_request key.


https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/#get-a-single-issue



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
(required)
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    owner
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    repo
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    number
    
(required)
    

string

    34.
    GET
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}/issues
    Issues - List issues for a repository.

**Note**: In the past, pull requests and issues were more closely aligned than they are now. As far as the API is concerned, every pull request is an issue, but not every issue is a pull request.

This endpoint may also return pull requests in the response. If an issue is a pull request, the object will include a ```pull_request``` key.

https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/#list-issues-for-a-repository





    
    
description

    
Issues - List issues for a repository.


Note: In the past, pull requests and issues were more closely aligned than they are now. As far as the API is concerned, every pull request is an issue, but not every issue is a pull request.


This endpoint may also return pull requests in the response. If an issue is a pull request, the object will include a pull_request key.


https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/#list-issues-for-a-repository



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required

    35.
    GET
    /issues
    Issues - List issues.

**Note**: In the past, pull requests and issues were more closely aligned than they are now. As far as the API is concerned, every pull request is an issue, but not every issue is a pull request.

This endpoint may also return pull requests in the response. If an issue is a pull request, the object will include a ```pull_request``` key.

List all issues **assigned** to the authenticated user across all visible repositories including owned repositories, member repositories, and organization repositories:

https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/#list-issues





    
    
description

    
Issues - List issues.


Note: In the past, pull requests and issues were more closely aligned than they are now. As far as the API is concerned, every pull request is an issue, but not every issue is a pull request.


This endpoint may also return pull requests in the response. If an issue is a pull request, the object will include a pull_request key.


List all issues assigned to the authenticated user across all visible repositories including owned repositories, member repositories, and organization repositories:


https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/#list-issues



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token

    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required

    36.
    PUT
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}/issues/{number}/lock
    Issues - Lock an issue.

**Note:** You can now add a reason when you lock an issue. This feature is currently available for developers to preview. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2018-01-10-lock-reason-api-preview) for full details. To access this feature, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.sailor-v-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

Users with push access can lock an issue or pull request's conversation.

https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/#lock-an-issue





    
    
description

    
Issues - Lock an issue.


Note: You can now add a reason when you lock an issue. This feature is currently available for developers to preview. See the blog post for full details. To access this feature, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.sailor-v-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


Users with push access can lock an issue or pull request's conversation.


https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/#lock-an-issue

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema

https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required

VII.
github-migration:
        Migration.

These APIs help you move projects to or from GitHub.

[https://developer.github.com/v3/migration/](https://developer.github.com/v3/migration/)

    
    expand / collapse operations




    
Migration.


These APIs help you move projects to or from GitHub.


https://developer.github.com/v3/migration/







    1.
    DELETE
    /orgs/{org}/migrations/{id}/archive
    Migrations - Delete a migration archive.

Deletes a previous migration archive. Migration archives are automatically deleted after seven days.

https://developer.github.com/v3/migration/migrations/#delete-a-migration-archive





    
    
description

    
Migrations - Delete a migration archive.


Deletes a previous migration archive. Migration archives are automatically deleted after seven days.


https://developer.github.com/v3/migration/migrations/#delete-a-migration-archive



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema

https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication

(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required

    body
    
(required)
    

object

    
    

        
{
    "exclude_attachments": false,
    "lock_repositories": false
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "exclude_attachments": {
        "default": false,
        "description": "Indicates whether attachments should be excluded from the migration (to reduce migration archive file size). Default: ```false```.\n",
        "type": "boolean",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "Indicates whether attachments should be excluded from the migration (to reduce migration archive file size). Default: ```false```.\n"
        ]
    },
    "lock_repositories": {
        "default": false,
        "description": "Indicates whether repositories should be locked (to prevent manipulation) while migrating data. Default: ```false```.\n",
        "type": "boolean",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "Indicates whether repositories should be locked (to prevent manipulation) while migrating data. Default: ```false```.\n"
        ]
    }
}

        http status code
        reason
    

    
    

        default

    6.
    DELETE
    /orgs/{org}/migrations/{id}/repos/{repo_name}/lock
    Migrations - Unlock a repository.

Unlocks a repository that was locked for migration. You should unlock each migrated repository and [delete them](https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/#delete-a-repository) when the migration is complete and you no longer need the source data.

https://developer.github.com/v3/migration/migrations/#unlock-a-repository





    
    
description

    
Migrations - Unlock a repository.


Unlocks a repository that was locked for migration. You should unlock each migrated repository and delete them when the migration is complete and you no longer need the source data.


https://developer.github.com/v3/migration/migrations/#unlock-a-repository



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token

https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication

    8.
    GET
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}/import/authors
    Source Imports - Get commit authors.

Each type of source control system represents authors in a different way. For example, a Git commit author has a display name and an email address, but a Subversion commit author just has a username. The GitHub Importer will make the author information valid, but the author might not be correct. For example, it will change the bare Subversion username ```hubot``` into something like ```hubot &lt;hubot@12341234-abab-fefe-8787-fedcba987654&gt;```.

This API method and the "Map a commit author" method allow you to provide correct Git author information.

https://developer.github.com/v3/migration/source_imports/#get-commit-authors





    
    
description

    
Source Imports - Get commit authors.


Each type of source control system represents authors in a different way. For example, a Git commit author has a display name and an email address, but a Subversion commit author just has a username. The GitHub Importer will make the author information valid, but the author might not be correct. For example, it will change the bare Subversion username hubot into something like hubot &#x26;lt;hubot@12341234-abab-fefe-8787-fedcba987654&#x26;gt;.


This API method and the "Map a commit author" method allow you to provide correct Git author information.


https://developer.github.com/v3/migration/source_imports/#get-commit-authors



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
(required)
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

(required)

    repo
    
(required)

    since
    
    

string

    11.
    PATCH
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}/import/authors/{author_id}
    Source Imports - Map a commit author.

Update an author's identity for the import. Your application can continue updating authors any time before you push new commits to the repository.

https://developer.github.com/v3/migration/source_imports/#map-a-commit-author





    
    
description

    
Source Imports - Map a commit author.


Update an author's identity for the import. Your application can continue updating authors any time before you push new commits to the repository.

    12.
    PATCH
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}/import/lfs
    Source Imports - Set Git LFS preference.

You can import repositories from Subversion, Mercurial, and TFS that include files larger than 100MB. This ability is powered by [Git LFS](https://git-lfs.github.com). You can learn more about our LFS feature and working with large files [on our help site](https://help.github.com/articles/versioning-large-files/).

https://developer.github.com/v3/migration/source_imports/#set-git-lfs-preference





    
    
description

    
Source Imports - Set Git LFS preference.


You can import repositories from Subversion, Mercurial, and TFS that include files larger than 100MB. This ability is powered by Git LFS. You can learn more about our LFS feature and working with large files on our help site.


https://developer.github.com/v3/migration/source_imports/#set-git-lfs-preference



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
(required)
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    owner
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    repo
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    body
    
(required)
    

object

    
    

        
{
    "use_lfs": "abcd1234"
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "use_lfs": {
        "description": "**Required** Can be one of ```opt_in``` (large files will be stored using Git LFS) or ```opt_out``` (large files will be removed during the import).\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required** Can be one of ```opt_in``` (large files will be stored using Git LFS) or ```opt_out``` (large files will be removed during the import).\n"
        ]
    }
}

description

Start a source import to a GitHub repository using GitHub Importer.

        data type
        value
        schema

(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.

    repo

(required)

{
    "tfvc_project": "abcd1234",
    "vcs": "abcd1234",
    "vcs_password": "abcd1234",
    "vcs_url": "abcd1234",
    "vcs_username": "abcd1234"
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "tfvc_project": {
        "description": "For a tfvc import, the name of the project that is being imported.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "For a tfvc import, the name of the project that is being imported.\n"
        ]
    },
    "vcs": {
        "description": "The originating VCS type. Can be one of ```subversion```, ```git```, ```mercurial```, or ```tfvc```. Please be aware that without this parameter, the import job will take additional time to detect the VCS type before beginning the import. This detection step will be reflected in the response.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "The originating VCS type. Can be one of ```subversion```, ```git```, ```mercurial```, or ```tfvc```. Please be aware that without this parameter, the import job will take additional time to detect the VCS type before beginning the import. This detection step will be reflected in the response.\n"
        ]
    },
    "vcs_password": {
        "description": "If authentication is required, the password to provide to ```vcs_url```.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "If authentication is required, the password to provide to ```vcs_url```.\n"
        ]
    },
    "vcs_url": {
        "description": "**Required** The URL of the originating repository.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required** The URL of the originating repository.\n"
        ]
    },
    "vcs_username": {
        "description": "If authentication is required, the username to provide to ```vcs_url```.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "If authentication is required, the username to provide to ```vcs_url```.\n"
        ]
    }
}

    14.
    PATCH
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}/import
    Source Imports - Update existing import.

An import can be updated with credentials or a project choice by passing in the appropriate parameters in this API request. If no parameters are provided, the import will be restarted.

https://developer.github.com/v3/migration/source_imports/#update-existing-import





    
    
description

    
Source Imports - Update existing import.


An import can be updated with credentials or a project choice by passing in the appropriate parameters in this API request. If no parameters are provided, the import will be restarted.


https://developer.github.com/v3/migration/source_imports/#update-existing-import

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
