VIII.
github-misc:
        Miscellaneous.

This is a miscellaneous set of APIs which provide access to top level GitHub resources and info.

[https://developer.github.com/v3/misc/](https://developer.github.com/v3/misc/)

    
    expand / collapse operations




    
Miscellaneous.


This is a miscellaneous set of APIs which provide access to top level GitHub resources and info.


https://developer.github.com/v3/misc/







    1.
    GET
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}
    Codes of Conduct - Get a repository's code of conduct.

When passed the preview media type, requests to get a repository will also return the repository's code of conduct if it can be detected from the repository's code of conduct file.

https://developer.github.com/v3/codes_of_conduct/#get-a-repositorys-code-of-conduct





    
    
description

    
Codes of Conduct - Get a repository's code of conduct.


When passed the preview media type, requests to get a repository will also return the repository's code of conduct if it can be detected from the repository's code of conduct file.


https://developer.github.com/v3/codes_of_conduct/#get-a-repositorys-code-of-conduct



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
(required)
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media

        "description": "The repository context to use when creating references in ```gfm``` mode. Omit this parameter when using ```markdown``` mode.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "The repository context to use when creating references in ```gfm``` mode. Omit this parameter when using ```markdown``` mode.\n"
        ]
    },
    "text": {
        "description": "**Required**. The Markdown text to render in HTML. Markdown content must be 400 KB or less.\n",
        "type": "string",

            "**Required**. The Markdown text to render in HTML. Markdown content must be 400 KB or less.\n"
        ]

IX.
github-orgs:
        Organizations.

**Note:** To help with migrating from our REST API v3 to GraphQL API v4, we're introducing a preview period to include the [GraphQL ```node_id```](https://developer.github.com/v3/#graphql-global-relay-ids) in the response for many REST API v3 resources. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2017-12-19-graphql-node-id) for full details. To access ```node_id``` during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.jean-grey-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

[https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/](https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/)

    
    expand / collapse operations




    
Organizations.


Note: To help with migrating from our REST API v3 to GraphQL API v4, we're introducing a preview period to include the GraphQL node_id in the response for many REST API v3 resources. See the blog post for full details. To access node_id during the preview period, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.jean-grey-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/

    5.
    PUT
    /orgs/{org}/memberships/{username}
    Organization Members - Add or update organization membership.

In order to create or update a user's membership with an organization, the authenticated user must be an organization owner.

- If the authenticated user is adding a member to the organization, the invited user will receive an email inviting them to the organization. The user's [membership status](https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/members/#get-organization-membership) will be ```pending``` until they accept the invitation.

- Authenticated users can update a user's membership by passing the ```role``` parameter. If the authenticated user changes a member's role to ```admin```, the affected user will receive an email notifying them that they've been made an organization owner. If the authenticated user changes an owner's role to ```member```, no email will be sent.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/members/#add-or-update-organization-membership





    
    
description

    
Organization Members - Add or update organization membership.


In order to create or update a user's membership with an organization, the authenticated user must be an organization owner.


    

  • If the authenticated user is adding a member to the organization, the invited user will receive an email inviting them to the organization. The user's membership status will be pending until they accept the invitation.
    

    • 

  • Authenticated users can update a user's membership by passing the role parameter. If the authenticated user changes a member's role to admin, the affected user will receive an email notifying them that they've been made an organization owner. If the authenticated user changes an owner's role to member, no email will be sent.
    

    • 



https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/members/#add-or-update-organization-membership



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
(required)
    
    

    
accept header

    9.
    POST
    /orgs/{org}/invitations
    Organization Members - Create organization invitation.

**Note:** You can now use the API to invite users to a GitHub organization. This feature is currently available for developers to preview. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2018-01-25-organization-invitation-api-preview) for full details. To access this feature, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.dazzler-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

Invite people to an organization by using their GitHub user ID or their email address. In order to create invitations in an organization, the authenticated user must be an organization owner.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/members/#create-organization-invitation





    
    
description

    
Organization Members - Create organization invitation.


Note: You can now use the API to invite users to a GitHub organization. This feature is currently available for developers to preview. See the blog post for full details. To access this feature, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.dazzler-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


Invite people to an organization by using their GitHub user ID or their email address. In order to create invitations in an organization, the authenticated user must be an organization owner.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/members/#create-organization-invitation

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema

(required)

    body
    
(required)
    

object

    
    

        
{
    "email": "abcd1234",
    "invitee_id": 0,
    "role": "abcd1234",
    "team_ids": [
        null
    ]
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "email": {
        "description": "**Required**. Email address of the person you are inviting, which can be an existing GitHub user. Not required if you provide ```invitee_id```.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required**. Email address of the person you are inviting, which can be an existing GitHub user. Not required if you provide ```invitee_id```.\n"
        ]
    },
    "invitee_id": {
        "description": "**Required**. GitHub user ID for the person you are inviting. Not required if you provide ```email```.\n",
        "type": "integer",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required**. GitHub user ID for the person you are inviting. Not required if you provide ```email```.\n"
        ]
    },
    "role": {
        "description": "Specify role for new member. Can be one of: * ```admin``` - Organization owners with full administrative rights to the organization and complete access to all repositories and teams. * ```direct_member``` - Non-owner organization members with ability to see other members and join teams by invitation. * ```billing_manager``` - Non-owner organization members with ability to manage the billing settings of your organization. Default: ```direct_member```.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "Specify role for new member. Can be one of: * ```admin``` - Organization owners with full administrative rights to the organization and complete access to all repositories and teams. * ```direct_member``` - Non-owner organization members with ability to see other members and join teams by invitation. * ```billing_manager``` - Non-owner organization members with ability to manage the billing settings of your organization. Default: ```direct_member```.\n"
        ]
    },
    "team_ids": {
        "default": [
            null
        ],
        "description": "Specify IDs for the teams you want to invite new members to.\n",
        "items": {
            "type": "string"
        },
        "type": "array",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "Specify IDs for the teams you want to invite new members to.\n"
        ]
    }
}

    13.
    GET
    /orgs/{org}/invitations/{invitation_id}/teams
    Organization Members - List organization invitation teams.

**Note:** You can now use the API to invite users to a GitHub organization. This feature is currently available for developers to preview. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2018-01-25-organization-invitation-api-preview) for full details. To access this feature, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.dazzler-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

List all teams associated with an invitation. In order to see invitations in an organization, the authenticated user must be an organization owner.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/members/#list-organization-invitation-teams





    
    
description

Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


List all teams associated with an invitation. In order to see invitations in an organization, the authenticated user must be an organization owner.

    14.
    GET
    /orgs/{org}/invitations
    Organization Members - List pending organization invitations.

**Note:** You can now use the API to invite users to a GitHub organization. This feature is currently available for developers to preview. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2018-01-25-organization-invitation-api-preview) for full details. To access this feature, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.dazzler-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

The return hash contains a ```role``` field which refers to the Organization Invitation role and will be one of the following values: ```direct_member```, ```admin```, ```billing_manager```, ```hiring_manager```, or ```reinstate```. If the invitee is not a GitHub member, the ```login``` field in the return hash will be ```null```.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/members/#list-pending-organization-invitations





    
    
description

    
Organization Members - List pending organization invitations.


Note: You can now use the API to invite users to a GitHub organization. This feature is currently available for developers to preview. See the blog post for full details. To access this feature, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.dazzler-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


The return hash contains a role field which refers to the Organization Invitation role and will be one of the following values: direct_member, admin, billing_manager, hiring_manager, or reinstate. If the invitee is not a GitHub member, the login field in the return hash will be null.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/members/#list-pending-organization-invitations



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token

https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required

    16.
    GET
    /orgs/{org}/members
    Organization Members - Members list.

List all users who are members of an organization. If the authenticated user is also a member of this organization then both concealed and public members will be returned.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/members/#members-list





    
    
description

    
Organization Members - Members list.


List all users who are members of an organization. If the authenticated user is also a member of this organization then both concealed and public members will be returned.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/members/#members-list

        data type

        schema

    17.
    GET
    /orgs/{org}/public_members
    Organization Members - Public members list.

Members of an organization can choose to have their membership publicized or not.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/members/#public-members-list





    
    
description

    
Organization Members - Public members list.


Members of an organization can choose to have their membership publicized or not.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/members/#public-members-list

    /orgs/{org}/members/{username}
    Organization Members - Remove a member.

Removing a user from this list will remove them from all teams and they will no longer have any access to the organization's repositories.

    21.
    PUT
    /orgs/{org}/outside_collaborators/{username}
    Organization Outside Collaborators - Convert member to outside collaborator.

When an organization member is converted to an outside collaborator, they'll only have access to the repositories that their current team membership allows. The user will no longer be a member of the organization. For more information, see "[Converting an organization member to an outside collaborator](https://help.github.com/articles/converting-an-organization-member-to-an-outside-collaborator/)".

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/outside_collaborators/#convert-member-to-outside-collaborator





    
    
description

    
Organization Outside Collaborators - Convert member to outside collaborator.


When an organization member is converted to an outside collaborator, they'll only have access to the repositories that their current team membership allows. The user will no longer be a member of the organization. For more information, see "Converting an organization member to an outside collaborator".


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/outside_collaborators/#convert-member-to-outside-collaborator



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema

    25.
    GET
    /orgs/{org}/pre-receive-hooks
    Organization Pre-receive Hooks - List pre-receive hooks.

List all pre-receive hooks that are enabled or testing for this organization as well as any disabled hooks that can be configured at the organization level. Globally disabled pre-receive hooks that do not allow downstream configuration are not listed.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/pre_receive_hooks/#list-pre-receive-hooks





    
    
description

    
Organization Pre-receive Hooks - List pre-receive hooks.


List all pre-receive hooks that are enabled or testing for this organization as well as any disabled hooks that can be configured at the organization level. Globally disabled pre-receive hooks that do not allow downstream configuration are not listed.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/pre_receive_hooks/#list-pre-receive-hooks

    27.
    PATCH
    /orgs/{org}/pre-receive-hooks/{id}
    Organization Pre-receive Hooks - Update pre-receive hook enforcement.

For pre-receive hooks which are allowed to be configured at the org level, you can set ```enforcement``` and ```allow_downstream_configuration```

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/pre_receive_hooks/#update-pre-receive-hook-enforcement

For pre-receive hooks which are allowed to be configured at the org level, you can set enforcement and allow_downstream_configuration


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/pre_receive_hooks/#update-pre-receive-hook-enforcement

    28.
    PUT
    /teams/{id}/memberships/{username}
    Organization Teams - Add or update team membership.

If the user is already a member of the team's organization, this endpoint will add the user to the team. To add a membership between an organization member and a team, the authenticated user must be an organization owner or a maintainer of the team.

If the user is unaffiliated with the team's organization, this endpoint will send an invitation to the user via email. This newly-created membership will be in the "pending" state until the user accepts the invitation, at which point the membership will transition to the "active" state and the user will be added as a member of the team. To add a membership between an unaffiliated user and a team, the authenticated user must be an organization owner.

If the user is already a member of the team, this endpoint will update the role of the team member's role. To update the membership of a team member, the authenticated user must be an organization owner or a maintainer of the team.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#add-or-update-team-membership





    
    
description

    
Organization Teams - Add or update team membership.


If the user is already a member of the team's organization, this endpoint will add the user to the team. To add a membership between an organization member and a team, the authenticated user must be an organization owner or a maintainer of the team.


If the user is unaffiliated with the team's organization, this endpoint will send an invitation to the user via email. This newly-created membership will be in the "pending" state until the user accepts the invitation, at which point the membership will transition to the "active" state and the user will be added as a member of the team. To add a membership between an unaffiliated user and a team, the authenticated user must be an organization owner.


If the user is already a member of the team, this endpoint will update the role of the team member's role. To update the membership of a team member, the authenticated user must be an organization owner or a maintainer of the team.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#add-or-update-team-membership



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
(required)
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    id
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    username
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    
    
response messages

    

        http status code
        reason
    

    
    

        default
        
default response


    

    
    
    
javascript code

    

    
curl request

    

    
response status code

    

    
response headers

    

    
response body

    

    









    29.
    PUT
    /teams/{id}/repos/{org}/{repo}#0
    Organization Teams - Add or update team repository.

**Note:** The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2017-08-30-preview-nested-teams) for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

To add a repository to a team or update the team's permission on a repository, the authenticated user must have admin access to the repository, and must be able to see the team. Also, the repository must be owned by the organization, or a direct fork of a repository owned by the organization.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#add-or-update-team-repository





    
    
description

    
Organization Teams - Add or update team repository.


Note: The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the blog post for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


To add a repository to a team or update the team's permission on a repository, the authenticated user must have admin access to the repository, and must be able to see the team. Also, the repository must be owned by the organization, or a direct fork of a repository owned by the organization.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#add-or-update-team-repository



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
(required)
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    id
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    org
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    repo
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    body
    
(required)
    

object

    
    

        
{
    "permission": "abcd1234"
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "permission": {
        "description": "The permission to grant the team on this repository. Can be one of: * ```pull``` - team members can pull, but not push to or administer this repository. * ```push``` - team members can pull and push, but not administer this repository. * ```admin``` - team members can pull, push and administer this repository.If no permission is specified, the team's ```permission``` attribute will be used to determine what permission to grant the team on this repository.**Note**: If you pass the ```hellcat-preview``` media type, you can promotebut not demotea ```permission``` attribute inherited through a parent team.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "The permission to grant the team on this repository. Can be one of: * ```pull``` - team members can pull, but not push to or administer this repository. * ```push``` - team members can pull and push, but not administer this repository. * ```admin``` - team members can pull, push and administer this repository.If no permission is specified, the team's ```permission``` attribute will be used to determine what permission to grant the team on this repository.**Note**: If you pass the ```hellcat-preview``` media type, you can promotebut not demotea ```permission``` attribute inherited through a parent team.\n"
        ]
    }
}





    
    
    
response messages

    

        http status code
        reason
    

    
    

        default
        
default response


    

    
    
    
javascript code

    

    
curl request

    

    
response status code

    

    
response headers

    

    
response body

    

    









    30.
    PUT
    /teams/{id}/members/{username}
    Organization Teams - Add team member.

Deprecation notice

The "Add team member" API (described below) is deprecated.

We recommend using the [Add team membership API](https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#add-or-update-team-membership) instead. It allows you to invite new organization members to your teams.

To add a user to a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin' permissions to the team or be an owner of the organization that the team is associated with, and the user being added must already be a member of at least one other team on the same organization.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#add-team-member





    
    
description

    
Organization Teams - Add team member.


Deprecation notice


The "Add team member" API (described below) is deprecated.


We recommend using the Add team membership API instead. It allows you to invite new organization members to your teams.


To add a user to a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin' permissions to the team or be an owner of the organization that the team is associated with, and the user being added must already be a member of at least one other team on the same organization.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#add-team-member

        name and description
        data type

    31.
    GET
    /teams/{id}/repos/{owner}/{repo}#1
    Organization Teams - Check if a team manages a repository.

**Note:** The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2017-08-30-preview-nested-teams) for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

**Note**: If you pass the ```hellcat-preview``` media type, repositories inherited through a parent team will be checked as well.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#check-if-a-team-manages-a-repository





    
    
description

    
Organization Teams - Check if a team manages a repository.


Note: The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the blog post for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


Note: If you pass the hellcat-preview media type, repositories inherited through a parent team will be checked as well.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#check-if-a-team-manages-a-repository

    32.
    POST
    /orgs/{org}/teams
    Organization Teams - Create team.

**Note:** The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2017-08-30-preview-nested-teams) for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

To create a team, the authenticated user must be a member of ```:org```.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#create-team





    
    
description

    
Organization Teams - Create team.


Note: The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the blog post for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


To create a team, the authenticated user must be a member of :org.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#create-team

        ]
    },
    "parent_team_id": {
        "description": "The ID of a team to set as the parent team. **Note**: You must pass the ```hellcat-preview``` media type to use this parameter.\n",

        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "The ID of a team to set as the parent team. **Note**: You must pass the ```hellcat-preview``` media type to use this parameter.\n"
        ]
    }

    33.
    DELETE
    /teams/{id}
    Organization Teams - Delete team.

**Note:** The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2017-08-30-preview-nested-teams) for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

To delete a team, the authenticated user must be a team maintainer or an owner of the org associated with the team.

If you are an organization owner and you pass the ```hellcat-preview``` media type, deleting a parent team will delete all of its child teams as well.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#delete-team





    
    
description

    
Organization Teams - Delete team.


Note: The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the blog post for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


To delete a team, the authenticated user must be a team maintainer or an owner of the org associated with the team.


If you are an organization owner and you pass the hellcat-preview media type, deleting a parent team will delete all of its child teams as well.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#delete-team

    34.
    PATCH
    /teams/{id}
    Organization Teams - Edit team.

**Note:** The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2017-08-30-preview-nested-teams) for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

To edit a team, the authenticated user must either be an owner of the org that the team is associated with, or a maintainer of the team.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#edit-team





    
    
description

    
Organization Teams - Edit team.


Note: The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the blog post for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


To edit a team, the authenticated user must either be an owner of the org that the team is associated with, or a maintainer of the team.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#edit-team

    35.
    GET
    /teams/{id}/members/{username}
    Organization Teams - Get team member.

Deprecation notice

The "Get team member" API (described below) is deprecated.

We recommend using the [Get team membership API](https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#get-team-membership) instead. It allows you to get both active and pending memberships.

To list members in a team, the team must be visible to the authenticated user.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#get-team-member





    
    
description

    
Organization Teams - Get team member.


Deprecation notice


The "Get team member" API (described below) is deprecated.


We recommend using the Get team membership API instead. It allows you to get both active and pending memberships.


To list members in a team, the team must be visible to the authenticated user.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#get-team-member

    36.
    GET
    /teams/{id}/memberships/{username}
    Organization Teams - Get team membership.

**Note:** The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2017-08-30-preview-nested-teams) for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

If you pass the ```hellcat-preview``` media type, team members will include the members of child teams.

To get a user's membership with a team, the team must be visible to the authenticated user.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#get-team-membership





    
    
description

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#get-team-membership

    38.
    GET
    /teams/{id}/teams
    Organization Teams - List child teams.

**Note:** The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2017-08-30-preview-nested-teams) for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

At this time, the ```hellcat-preview``` media type is required to use this endpoint.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#list-child-teams





    
    
description

    
Organization Teams - List child teams.


Note: The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the blog post for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


At this time, the hellcat-preview media type is required to use this endpoint.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#list-child-teams

        name and description
        data type
        value

(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.

    39.
    GET
    /teams/{id}/invitations
    Organization Teams - List pending team invitations.

**Note:** You can now use the API to invite users to a GitHub organization. This feature is currently available for developers to preview. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2018-01-25-organization-invitation-api-preview) for full details. To access this feature, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.dazzler-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

The return hash contains a ```role``` field which refers to the Organization Invitation role and will be one of the following values: ```direct_member```, ```admin```, ```billing_manager```, ```hiring_manager```, or ```reinstate```. If the invitee is not a GitHub member, the ```login``` field in the return hash will be ```null```.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#list-pending-team-invitations





    
    
description

    
Organization Teams - List pending team invitations.


Note: You can now use the API to invite users to a GitHub organization. This feature is currently available for developers to preview. See the blog post for full details. To access this feature, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.dazzler-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


The return hash contains a role field which refers to the Organization Invitation role and will be one of the following values: direct_member, admin, billing_manager, hiring_manager, or reinstate. If the invitee is not a GitHub member, the login field in the return hash will be null.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#list-pending-team-invitations

    40.
    GET
    /teams/{id}/members
    Organization Teams - List team members.

**Note:** The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2017-08-30-preview-nested-teams) for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

If you pass the ```hellcat-preview``` media type, team members will include the members of child teams.

To list members in a team, the team must be visible to the authenticated user.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#list-team-members





    
    
description

    
Organization Teams - List team members.


Note: The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the blog post for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


If you pass the hellcat-preview media type, team members will include the members of child teams.


To list members in a team, the team must be visible to the authenticated user.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#list-team-members

    41.
    GET
    /teams/{id}/repos
    Organization Teams - List team repos.

**Note:** The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2017-08-30-preview-nested-teams) for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

**Note**: If you pass the ```hellcat-preview``` media type, the response will include any repositories inherited through a parent team.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#list-team-repos

Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.

    43.
    GET
    /user/teams
    Organization Teams - List user teams.

**Note:** The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2017-08-30-preview-nested-teams) for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

List all of the teams across all of the organizations to which the authenticated user belongs. This method requires ```user```, ```repo```, or ```read:org``` [scope](https://developer.github.com/apps/building-integrations/setting-up-and-registering-oauth-apps/about-scopes-for-oauth-apps/) when authenticating via [OAuth](https://developer.github.com/apps/building-integrations/setting-up-and-registering-oauth-apps/).

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#list-user-teams





    
    
description

    
Organization Teams - List user teams.


Note: The Nested Teams API is currently available for developers to preview. See the blog post for full details. To access the API, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.hellcat-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


List all of the teams across all of the organizations to which the authenticated user belongs. This method requires user, repo, or read:org scope when authenticating via OAuth.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#list-user-teams

    44.
    DELETE
    /teams/{id}/members/{username}
    Organization Teams - Remove team member.

Deprecation notice

The "Remove team member" API (described below) is deprecated.

We recommend using the [Remove team membership API](https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#remove-team-membership) instead. It allows you to remove both active and pending memberships.

To remove a user from a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin' permissions to the team or be an owner of the org that the team is associated with. NOTE: This does not delete the user, it just removes them from the team.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#remove-team-member





    
    
description

    
Organization Teams - Remove team member.


Deprecation notice


The "Remove team member" API (described below) is deprecated.


We recommend using the Remove team membership API instead. It allows you to remove both active and pending memberships.


To remove a user from a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin' permissions to the team or be an owner of the org that the team is associated with. NOTE: This does not delete the user, it just removes them from the team.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#remove-team-member



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema

https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required

    45.
    DELETE
    /teams/{id}/memberships/{username}
    Organization Teams - Remove team membership.

To remove a membership between a user and a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin' permissions to the team or be an owner of the organization that the team is associated with. NOTE: This does not delete the user, it just removes their membership from the team.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#remove-team-membership





    
    
description

    
Organization Teams - Remove team membership.


To remove a membership between a user and a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin' permissions to the team or be an owner of the organization that the team is associated with. NOTE: This does not delete the user, it just removes their membership from the team.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#remove-team-membership

    46.
    DELETE
    /teams/{id}/repos/{owner}/{repo}#1
    Organization Teams - Remove team repository.

If the authenticated user is an organization owner or a team maintainer, they can remove any repositories from the team. To remove a repository from a team as an organization member, the authenticated user must have admin access to the repository and must be able to see the team. NOTE: This does not delete the repository, it just removes it from the team.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#remove-team-repository





    
    
description

    
Organization Teams - Remove team repository.


If the authenticated user is an organization owner or a team maintainer, they can remove any repositories from the team. To remove a repository from a team as an organization member, the authenticated user must have admin access to the repository and must be able to see the team. NOTE: This does not delete the repository, it just removes it from the team.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#remove-team-repository

    org

    body
    
(required)
    

object

    
    

        
{
    "active": true,
    "config": {},
    "events": [
        "[\"push\"]"
    ]
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "active": {
        "default": true,
        "description": "Determines if notifications are sent when the webhook is triggered. Set to ```true``` to send notifications. Default: ```true```.\n",
        "type": "boolean",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "Determines if notifications are sent when the webhook is triggered. Set to ```true``` to send notifications. Default: ```true```.\n"
        ]
    },
    "config": {
        "description": "**Required**. Key/value pairs to provide settings for this webhook. [These are defined below](https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/hooks/#create-hook-config-params).\n",
        "type": "object",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required**. Key/value pairs to provide settings for this webhook. [These are defined below](https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/hooks/#create-hook-config-params).\n"
        ]
    },
    "events": {
        "default": [
            "[\"push\"]"
        ],
        "description": "Determines what [events](https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/types/) the hook is triggered for. Default: ```[\"push\"]```.\n",
        "items": {
            "type": "string"
        },
        "type": "array",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "Determines what [events](https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/types/) the hook is triggered for. Default: ```[\"push\"]```.\n"
        ]
    }
}





    
    
    
response messages

    

        http status code
        reason
    

    
    

        default
        
default response


    

    
    
    
javascript code

    48.
    DELETE
    /orgs/{org}/hooks/{id}
    Organization Webhooks - Delete a hook.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/hooks/#delete-a-hook





    
    
description

        "default": [
            "[\"push\"]"
        ],

            "type": "string"

        "type": "array",

            "Determines what [events](https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/types/) the hook is triggered for. Default: ```[\"push\"]```.\n"

    55.
    GET
    /organizations
    Organizations - List all organizations.

Lists all organizations, in the order that they were created on GitHub.

**Note:** Pagination is powered exclusively by the ```since``` parameter. Use the [Link header](https://developer.github.com/v3/#link-header) to get the URL for the next page of organizations.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/#list-all-organizations





    
    
description

    
Organizations - List all organizations.


Lists all organizations, in the order that they were created on GitHub.


Note: Pagination is powered exclusively by the since parameter. Use the Link header to get the URL for the next page of organizations.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/#list-all-organizations

    56.
    GET
    /users/{username}/orgs
    Organizations - List user organizations.

List [public organization memberships](https://help.github.com/articles/publicizing-or-concealing-organization-membership) for the specified user.

This method only lists public memberships, regardless of authentication. If you need to fetch all of the organization memberships (public and private) for the authenticated user, use the [List your organizations](https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/#list-your-organizations) API instead.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/#list-user-organizations





    
    
description

    
Organizations - List user organizations.


List public organization memberships for the specified user.


This method only lists public memberships, regardless of authentication. If you need to fetch all of the organization memberships (public and private) for the authenticated user, use the List your organizations API instead.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/#list-user-organizations



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required

    57.
    GET
    /user/orgs
    Organizations - List your organizations.

List organizations for the authenticated user. OAuth scope requirements

This only lists organizations that your authorization allows you to operate on in some way (e.g., you can list teams with ```read:org``` scope, you can publicize your organization membership with ```user``` scope, etc.). Therefore, this API requires at least ```user``` or ```read:org``` scope. OAuth requests with insufficient scope receive a ```403 Forbidden``` response.

https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/#list-your-organizations





    
    
description

    
Organizations - List your organizations.


List organizations for the authenticated user. OAuth scope requirements


This only lists organizations that your authorization allows you to operate on in some way (e.g., you can list teams with read:org scope, you can publicize your organization membership with user scope, etc.). Therefore, this API requires at least user or read:org scope. OAuth requests with insufficient scope receive a 403 Forbidden response.


https://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/#list-your-organizations



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept

https://developer.github.com/v3/media

response body

    

    













    
        
X.
github-projects:
        Projects.

**Note:** To help with migrating from our REST API v3 to GraphQL API v4, we're introducing a preview period to include the [GraphQL ```node_id```](https://developer.github.com/v3/#graphql-global-relay-ids) in the response for many REST API v3 resources. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2017-12-19-graphql-node-id) for full details. To access ```node_id``` during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.jean-grey-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

The Projects API is currently available for developers to preview. During the preview period, the API may change without advance notice. Please see the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2016-10-27-changes-to-projects-api) for full details.

To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ``` application/vnd.github.inertia-preview+json ```

[https://developer.github.com/v3/projects/](https://developer.github.com/v3/projects/)

    
    expand / collapse operations




    
Projects.


Note: To help with migrating from our REST API v3 to GraphQL API v4, we're introducing a preview period to include the GraphQL node_id in the response for many REST API v3 resources. See the blog post for full details. To access node_id during the preview period, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.jean-grey-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


The Projects API is currently available for developers to preview. During the preview period, the API may change without advance notice. Please see the blog post for full details.


To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.inertia-preview+json


https://developer.github.com/v3/projects/







    1.
    POST
    /projects/columns/{column_id}/cards
    Project cards - Create a project card.

https://developer.github.com/v3/projects/cards/#create-a-project-card





    
    
description

    
Project cards - Create a project card.


https://developer.github.com/v3/projects/cards/#create-a-project-card



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
(required)
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    column_id
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    body
    
(required)
    

object

    
    

        
{
    "content_id": 0,
    "content_type": "abcd1234",
    "note": "abcd1234"
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "content_id": {
        "description": "The id of the issue to associate with this card.\n",
        "type": "integer",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "The id of the issue to associate with this card.\n"
        ]
    },
    "content_type": {
        "description": "**Required if you specify a content_id**. The type of content to associate with this card. Can only be \"Issue\" at this time.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required if you specify a content_id**. The type of content to associate with this card. Can only be \"Issue\" at this time.\n"
        ]
    },
    "note": {
        "description": "The card's note content. Only valid for cards without another type of content, so this must be omitted if ```content_id``` and ```content_type``` are specified.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "The card's note content. Only valid for cards without another type of content, so this must be omitted if ```content_id``` and ```content_type``` are specified.\n"
        ]
    }
}





    
    
    
response messages

    

        http status code
        reason
    

    
    

        default
        
default response


    

    
    
    
javascript code

response headers

object

    
    

        
{
    "position": "abcd1234"
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "position": {
        "description": "**Required**. Can be one of ```top```, ```bottom```, or ```after:&lt;card_id&gt;```, where ```&lt;card_id&gt;``` is the ```id``` value of a card in the same column, or in the new column specified by ```column_id```.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required**. Can be one of ```top```, ```bottom```, or ```after:&lt;card_id&gt;```, where ```&lt;card_id&gt;``` is the ```id``` value of a card in the same column, or in the new column specified by ```column_id```.\n"
        ]
    }
}

        "description": "The card's note content. Only valid for cards without another type of content, so this cannot be specified if the card already has a ```content_id``` and ```content_type```.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "The card's note content. Only valid for cards without another type of content, so this cannot be specified if the card already has a ```content_id``` and ```content_type```.\n"
        ]
    }

        "type": "string",

            "The body of the project.\n"
        ]
    },
    "state": {
        "description": "State of the project. Either ```open``` or ```closed```.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "State of the project. Either ```open``` or ```closed```.\n"
        ]
    }
}

XI.
github-pulls:
        Pull Requests.

The Pull Request API allows you to list, view, edit, create, and even merge pull requests. Comments on pull requests can be managed via the [Issue Comments API](https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/comments/).

Pull Requests use [these custom media types](https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/#custom-media-types). You can read more about the use of media types in the API [here](https://developer.github.com/v3/media/).

**Note:** To help with migrating from our REST API v3 to GraphQL API v4, we're introducing a preview period to include the [GraphQL ```node_id```](https://developer.github.com/v3/#graphql-global-relay-ids) in the response for many REST API v3 resources. See the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2017-12-19-graphql-node-id) for full details. To access ```node_id``` during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media) in the ```Accept``` header: ```application/vnd.github.jean-grey-preview+json ```

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

[https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/](https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/)

    
    expand / collapse operations




    
Pull Requests.


The Pull Request API allows you to list, view, edit, create, and even merge pull requests. Comments on pull requests can be managed via the Issue Comments API.


Pull Requests use these custom media types. You can read more about the use of media types in the API here.


Note: To help with migrating from our REST API v3 to GraphQL API v4, we're introducing a preview period to include the GraphQL node_id in the response for many REST API v3 resources. See the blog post for full details. To access node_id during the preview period, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header: application/vnd.github.jean-grey-preview+json


Warning: The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact GitHub support.


https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/







    1.
    POST
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pulls
    Pull Requests - Create a pull request.

https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/#create-a-pull-request





    
    
description

    
Pull Requests - Create a pull request.


https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/#create-a-pull-request



    
    
parameters

    

        name and description
        data type
        value
        schema
    

    
    


    access_token
    
    
    

    
OAuth2 token (sent as a parameter)


https://developer.github.com/v3/#authentication


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    user-agent
    
(required)
    
    

    
All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your GitHub username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems.


https://developer.github.com/v3/index.html#user-agent-required


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    accept
    
    
    

    
accept header


https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    owner
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    repo
    
(required)
    

string

    
    
    
    
    
    
    



    




    
    


    body
    
(required)
    

object

    
    

        
{
    "base": "abcd1234",
    "body": "abcd1234",
    "head": "abcd1234",
    "maintainer_can_modify": false,
    "title": "abcd1234"
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "base": {
        "description": "**Required**. The name of the branch you want the changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repository that requests a merge to a base of another repository.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required**. The name of the branch you want the changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repository that requests a merge to a base of another repository.\n"
        ]
    },
    "body": {
        "description": "The contents of the pull request.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "The contents of the pull request.\n"
        ]
    },
    "head": {
        "description": "**Required**. The name of the branch where your changes are implemented. For cross-repository pull requests in the same network, namespace ```head``` with a user like this: ```username:branch```.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required**. The name of the branch where your changes are implemented. For cross-repository pull requests in the same network, namespace ```head``` with a user like this: ```username:branch```.\n"
        ]
    },
    "maintainer_can_modify": {
        "description": "Indicates whether [maintainers can modify](https://help.github.com/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork/) the pull request.\n",
        "type": "boolean",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "Indicates whether [maintainers can modify](https://help.github.com/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork/) the pull request.\n"
        ]
    },
    "title": {
        "description": "**Required**. The title of the pull request.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "**Required**. The title of the pull request.\n"
        ]
    }
}





    
    
    
response messages

    

        http status code
        reason
    

    
    

        default
        
default response


    

    
    
    
javascript code

response status code

    4.
    GET
    /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pulls/{number}/commits
    Pull Requests - List commits on a pull request.

**Note:** The response includes a maximum of 250 commits. To receive a complete commit list for pull requests with more than 250 commits, use the [Commit List API](https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/commits/#list-commits-on-a-repository).

https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/#list-commits-on-a-pull-request

https://developer.github.com/v3/media


    

string

    "commit_message": "abcd1234",
    "commit_title": "abcd1234",
    "merge_method": "abcd1234"
}

        
    

    
    
    
    
    



    
{
    "commit_message": {
        "description": "Extra detail to append to automatic commit message.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "Extra detail to append to automatic commit message.\n"
        ]
    },
    "commit_title": {
        "description": "Title for the automatic commit message.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "Title for the automatic commit message.\n"
        ]
    },
    "merge_method": {
        "description": "Merge method to use. Possible values are ```merge```, ```squash``` or ```rebase```. Default is ```merge```.\n",
        "type": "string",
        "x-swgg-descriptionLineList": [
            "Merge method to use. Possible values are ```merge```, ```squash``` or ```rebase```. Default is ```merge```.\n"
        ]
    }
}





    
    
    
response messages

    

        http status code
        reason
    

    
    

        default
        
default response


    

    
    
    
javascript code

    

    
curl request

    

    
response status code
